Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is brown-black in section, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, with remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.184)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36429) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36429)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 287 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13475 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
